Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Jevon Caldwell-Gross, Associate Minister, Concord Baptist Church of Christ, 833 Gardner Taylor Blvd, Brooklyn, NY 11216.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vann.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Reverend Jevon Caldwell-Gross, Associate Minister, Concord Baptist Church of Christ, 833 Gardner Taylor Blvd, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11216.

Council Member Vann moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of September 4 and September 24, 2008 be adopted as printed by Council Member Dilan.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Dilan moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 4, 2008 and September 24, 2008 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 080519 ZSX, a special permit, C 080520 ZSX, a special permit, and C 080521 PQX, an acquisition, shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to applications no. C 080517 ZMX, N 080518 ZRY and C 080522 HAX that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Via Verde/The Green Way, Bronx (C080520ZSX)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application nos. C 080204 MMQ and C 080207 (A) ZSQ shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 080203 ZMQ.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 151-45 6th Road, Whitestone Partners, LLC, Queens (C080203ZMQ)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution concerning the establishment of the Hudson Square Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Hudson Square BID, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to evaluation of sites for hidden driveway signs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Evaluation of sites for hidden driveway signs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to renumbering a duplicate section number in title 19.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Renumbering a duplicate section number in title 19.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to conduct traffic studies for any school with students at or below the eighth grade level.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: DOT  to conduct traffic studies for any school with students at or below the eighth grade level.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring the department of buildings to establish an emergency notification system.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of buildings to establish an emergency notification system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to inspection of cranes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Inspection of cranes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon upon Congress and New York State to provide a specific allocation of capital funding for elevators at New York City Housing Authority projects.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Congress and NYS to provide a specific allocation of capital funding for elevators at NYC Housing Authority projects.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass S.4164/A.2989, an act to amend the civil practice law and rules, in relation to equalizing the treatment of collateral sources in tort actions against public defendants by applying the same standard used in cases against private defendants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the civil practice law and rules, in relation to equalizing the treatment of collateral sources in tort actions against public defendants by applying the same standard used in cases against private defendants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to limiting the jurisdiction of the Commissioner of the Department of Parks and Recreation to Parks Department property.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Limiting the jurisdiction of the Commissioner of the Department of Parks and Recreation to Parks Department property.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to ensure that veterans in VA facilities are able to exercise their right to vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Veterans Affairs (VA) to ensure that veterans in VA facilities are able to exercise their right to vote.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the waterfront management advisory board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Waterfront management advisory board.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the Governor to amend State law to allow non-citizens who have served in the United States military to become police officers and firefighters.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Amend State law to allow non-citizens who have served in the United States military to become police officers and firefighters.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to pass legislation that would require the owners of dangerous dogs to obtain liability insurance for personal injury or death of any person, resulting from an attack of such dangerous dog.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Require the owners of dangerous dogs to obtain liability insurance for personal injury or death of any person, resulting from an attack of such dangerous dog.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to independent inspection of cranes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Independent inspection of cranes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a centralized system for information on real property.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Creating a centralized system for information on real property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Hudson Square business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Hudson Square BID, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to bicycle access to office buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Bicycle access to office buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would allow real estate developers to defer payment of New York City’s mortgage recording taxes on new construction projects until after the construction of such projects are complete.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Allow real estate developers to defer payment of New York City’s mortgage recording taxes on new construction projects until after the construction of such projects are complete.

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Acting Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, November 19, 2008.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, First Deputy City Clerk
Acting Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 080385 HDQ, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning the disposition of city-owned property located within the proposed Willets Point Renewal Area, in Council District no. 21, Borough of Queens.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Willets Point Renewal Area, Queens (C080385HDQ)

Items.Title: Application  no.  N 080363 ZRQ submitted by the Department of City Planning pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for amendment to the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York concerning the addition Article XII, Chapter 5, (Special Southern Hunters Point District), to establish a special district and modify related regulations.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Special Southern Hunters Point District, Queens (N080363ZRQ)

Items.Title: Application no. C 080364 PPQ, pursuant to §197-c of the New York City Charter, for the acquisition of property located at 2nd Street (Block1, Lots 1 and 10; Block 5, lot 1; Block 6, Lots 1,2 and 14); the bed of 54th Avenue between 2nd Street and the East River; and the bed of 55th Avenue between 2nd Street and the East River.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Hunts Point South Rezoning, Queens (C080364PPQ)

Items.Title: Application no. Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Hunter’s Point South, Queens (C080365HAQ)
